Reviews.Content: Great Location, rooms OK While the location was great, the rooms didn't have a fridge and we were told we couldn't bring food to the room. Breakfast was OK. There is a little shop to the right of the hotel. Get your drinks  snacks there since it's much cheaper than anywhere else. Booked through Orbitz and was told that I needed to pay for the room in cash, since it was discounted. Booked for a week so I didn't have that much and had to use the ATM and get money from different accounts. Sometimes the electricity would go out and we would have to call for them to turn it on. They do this in case people leave lights on, I guess. The room was never vacuumed the whole time we were there since we saw the same crumbs on the floor the whole time.
Reviews.Author: dizzkat

Reviews.Content: Let say SURPRISE We have spend 3 days in Florance, in De Lanzi Hotel. OK, for sure it has great location, street next to Duomo and one can walk and see everything you should see easily. Everything is near to De Lanzi Hotel.Rooms are small, but clear. Neither nice neither ugly 鈥?let say just ok.Front desk: friendly staff, ready to help.Breakfast 鈥?very poor. Espresso was not included in breakfast, brad is not tasty. We expected much more since whole Italy has a great food and coffee. Worst moment about Florence an hotel is parking. If you are planning to go to Florence by car change your plan!!! You can鈥檛 park car anyway, price in public garage is 5 Euros per hour (let me calculate for you 鈥?120 Euros per day). De Lance did us a 鈥榝avor鈥?and they organize guy who parked our car for just 25 Euros per day. He called us firs morning on hotel at 8am and started to explain something in Italian. Of course we didn鈥檛 understand a word. We asked a lady at front desk to call him back, see what was all about and tell us. She did so and tell us that he had some problem with alarm of our car but he solved it on his own. We were really surprised when we got our car back. Guy from garage turn off electricity in the car, broke cd player and reverser. All for 25 Euros per day.If you are planning trip to Florance, don鈥檛 go by car.
Reviews.Author: newone37

Reviews.Content: It grows sweeter with time I had won a contest with Conde Nast Traveler and they put us up here for four days. At first it was not what I expected, but the rooms were clean, the beds okay, the breakfast was above what other places serve there. We were right by the Duomo and that was a blessing. You could go down by the Duomo late at midnight or later and there is a little hole in the wall place that is really good that the college kids go too. Loved talking with them. All the places you go there to see are in walking distance and I don't walk too far. Vivoli's gellato was to die for and it was pretty close too-made more than a few trips there. If you call the hotel before you go they will get you tickets for the Academia, Uffizi. Best bet on the Uffizi as we saw tourists get turned away. Anyways, the question was would I go back and I would.Okay, the staff could of been a little friendlier and I was told I could see the duomo from my room-didn't happen. I was just determined not be an ugly American and I think I pulled it off.
Reviews.Author: tlhanger

Reviews.Content: Perfect location My husband and I recently celebrated our one year anniversary in Italy. We stayed at the Hotel De Lanzi in Florence and it was a great experience. The hotel was steps away from the Duomo so the location was ideal. Staff members were helpful with giving us directions and recommendations for restaurants. The rooms and accomodations were adequate.
Reviews.Author: mimiabbate

Reviews.Content: perfect location hotel didn't deliver We arranged to stay 8 nights at this hotel via email. They would respond politely and promptly to all my requests. We received a good low season rate and we were promised a partial view of the Duomo from our room. When we arrived we were told our rate would only be honored if we paid in cash. Since there was at least 6 emails exchanged , one would think they had ample time to let us know that cash only for this rate was in effect. They did accept credit cards! This caused us to incur several transaction fees on our debit card as we accumulated a weeks rent. Instead of one tranaction charge for the bill if it was placed on the credit card. They then told us the rooms with the views were not available to us. This seemed to me to be the Italain hotel version of bait and switch. We ended up with a view on a courtyard where the motorbikes were parked. This motorbike sound was our alarm clock each morning that we were there. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was nicely done but would flood after each shower. The bar had an espresso machine that was used by the staff to prepare their coffee but an automatic machine was used to serve breakfast. What is breafast in Italy without good coffee! The owner matriarch stood guard at the breakfast as if she was watching her silverware. This was very offputting. The facility is nice, clean and comfortable. The staff and their attitudes left a lot to be desired.I would stay again but you should verify rate and method of payment.
Reviews.Author: travelitaly7

Reviews.Content: Good location, so-so staff Perfect location for a beautiful stay in Florence. The rooms were ok...no great views, a little on the ugly side, and the A/C wasn't that fabulous either...but for our budget it worked out great and was a LOT better than some of the accommodations we were stuck with on our honeymoon.The 2 ladies at the front desk were a little moody and were arguing with us because we got lost in our rental car in Florence's crazy streets and were 10 minutes late to check out.
Reviews.Author: szberi

Reviews.Content: loved the de lanzi My husband and I with our 2 daughters and their husbands have just spent a few days away in florence, italy because a cousin of mine wasgetting married there. My daughter and I spent many hours looking fora small hotel in florence and not far from the many attractions and of course not far from the church and venue. We found a web site called VENERE.COM which even for me was so easy to use. On this website was Hotel de Lanzi which we thought would be perfect for our very busy weekend...and i'm pleased to say that it was perfect. We occupied 3 double rooms which i can truely say were very tastefully decorated with the added pleasure of new bedroom furniture. The en-suite was immaculate. The breakfast was plentiful....croissants, rolls, ham, cheese, jam, tea, coffee and fruit juice... a complete continental breakfast. We really couldn't believe our luck. The lady on reception was so pleasant, she had a lovely sense of humour and very helpful. I was a little worried about asking the hotel for a taxi but i had no need to worry. They made the call and a taxi was outside waiting 5 minutes later. Brilliant service.. we're not used to service like that in Britain!I really do recommend this hotel....location....rooms....breakfast and friendly staff....We will be visiting florence again and we know where we will be staying!
Reviews.Author: victoria006

Reviews.Content: only good thing: Location The only good thing about this hotel is it location in Florence and given how many other hotels there are in florence I am sure that the average person can do much better than stay in this hotel. The entrance to the hotel is scruffy, dirty and tasteless.The lift to the hotel is so old, small and bad looking that you would have to settle to climbing 2 storeys of stairs every time. The rooms are oldish style but clean and not minute. The breakfast is so bad that I had to go and but a cereal from a nearby grocer and settle for that. The night receptions stank so much that it polluted all the reception area. The lift to the hotel is so old, small and bad looking that you would have to settle to climbing 2 storeys of stairs every time.
Reviews.Author: cbon014

Reviews.Content: Worse experience ever with a hotel Never ask for the familly room The air condition is not properly functioning and there is no space at all for 4 people. The staff was polite but not efficient and sometimes even make things worse. The location is central but the entrance doesn t look as a hotel at all My advice : avoid this hotel at all
Reviews.Author: Shebatourist

Reviews.Content: Noisy location This location was very noisy, just a block away from the Duomo and in the middle of the busy tourist area. The staff was not very friendly. The location did aford us less walking, however, this place was not a highlight of our trip.
Reviews.Author: dsmemory

Reviews.Content: Great Location, Great Price, Highly Recommended As you walk out the front door of the Hotel De Lanzi you see the Duomo one block away down this charing little alley. Now how can you beat that for location? Everything we wanted to see was within easy walking distance and you always had the Duomo as you landmark to get back to the hotel..My room had 2 twin beds made up as a full size and was very clean and very comfortable. The room was small by American standards but this ain't America. It had lots of storage space, a large bathroom with full facilities and a huge shower. There was also a safe in the clothes cabinet and windows that opened over the small open air courtyard. That was a nice touch since it allowed the cool late March air into the room and I had the church bells for a wake up call.The free breakfast had cereal, rolls, croissants, swiss cheese, ham, coffee, milk, tomato juice, orange juice and some very good coffee. I've had worse at more expensive hotels in Europe.Overall I highly recommend the Hotel De Lanzi. It's not the fanciest place in Firenze you but can't beat it for the price, the comfort, the staff.Be sure to go check out their website. [--] . Under the Location tab there is a map with a satellite option. My friend and I knew exactly where to go from the train station thanks to that satellite view. Now that I'm home I've been using it to reminisce about all of the incredible places we went to while we were there.One really important tip for those that want to see the Uffizi Gallery and the David at the Academia. Book your tickets on the internet at [--] before you leave the US! We had reservations for 10:30AM at the Uffizi. There were several hundred people waiting on line to get in at 9:15AM but the line for the reserved people had maybe 20 people in it! We went to have a croissant and cappuccino and when we came back at 10:15AM we went to Door 1, got our tickets (1 minute wait) then walked across to the reserved line and were in the door right at 10:30. Same with the Academia. Reserve online. It's worth it.
Reviews.Author: TravlinMan52

Reviews.Content: Good location hotel in Florence The De Lanzi is a medium priced Florence hotel located just by the Duomo. Rooms are simply furnished but clean and comfortable. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is standard continental - adequate without being exciting. The main advantage that the De Lanzi has is its excellent location right within the centre of historical Florence. If you want a no frills place to lay your head while exploring this wonderful city this hotel provides just that.
Reviews.Author: firsdene

Reviews.Content: Not what I expected My wife and I booked the alleged family room for ourselves and our two teens. The room was extremely small, even by European standards, and consisted of 4 beds lined next to each other with barely room in between. The bathroom was small, and the shower stall was so tiny you could barely move without worrying about the thing falling over. We were in Italy for 2 weks, 4 hotels and cities, and this was by far the lowest rated by our group - except for my wife - somehow she thought it was nice.It is centrally located, and the staff was excellent, and the duomo is very close. All in all the hotel was just okay - but I'd probably shop around if I was going back.
Reviews.Author: Tedtrout1

Reviews.Content: Suitable, good location I enjoyed the hotel, but it was nothing fancy. The breakfast was decent, as was the laundry service. The room was nice and suitable. The bathroom was large with a tub and shower. The location was superb! Off the beaten tourist path from the Duomo, yet on the edge of the best shopping district.Acton, ON, Canada
Reviews.Author: mcasscanada

Reviews.Content: One of Europes Worst Hotels       The "View of the Duomo" from the hotel
Reviews.Author: Kedwyn

Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful :) Very nice hotel. It's very conveniently located, the rooms were nice (with an excellent, spacious bathroom), the breakfast was good and the staff were friendly and very helpful :)
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great hotel in centre of Flrence, great value for money When we first went to Florence our hotel was little outside the old city and we had a fair old walk backwards and forwards. This isn't really a problem if you're just intending to leave in the morning and return in the evening, but if you want to pop back to the hotel to rest, drop off heavy guide books, presents and the like it becomes a chore. So when we decided to return we looked for a hotel a little which was more central.We found the Hotel di Lanzi, which looked central, looked about the right price, and we hoped that it would be okay for us. Our expectations of a hotel aren't too high, we want a clean comfortable room, friendly and helpful staff, and peace and quiet to rest in.When we arrived at the Hotel di Lanzi we were stunned at how great the location was. From the door of the hotel you can see the Duomo (though down a little side street), and it is literally 20 yards or so from Piazza San Giovanni where the Duomo sits.The hotel provided good clean rooms with large en-suite bathrooms, heating and air-conditioning available for each room, an excellent buffet breakfast, a bar, and internet access (very useful if you want to keep an eye on you bank account while you're spending too much).We got everything we wanted and a lot more, but better than all of this was the service. The staff spoke fluent English, and were extremely helpful. We had a problem with our luggage being lost by our airline and we had difficulties sorting this out, having to telephone airports in Bologna and Florence, and we seemed to be banging our heads against a brick wall, but when we explained the problem to the staff they took over for us, made phone calls and sorted everything out. This was a huge relief. This is just one example of how helpful they were. They made our stay so much more enjoyable.I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay right in the centre of Florence, especially if they are on a tight budget. Information on the hotel itself is available on-line if you do a search.Happy TravellingMichael Marchant
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Perfectly Satisfactory We travelled with 2 other couples to Florence and booked at the De' Lanzi. When we arrived we were told that they were moving us to another location, which was on the Piazza Republica (a short distance away) since we were staying 3 nights. We had apartment style room arrangements with cooking facilities, which we did not need, except that it was nice having a refrigerator for our beverages. We were more than pleased with the rooms, and found them to be extremely clean and comfortable. Also, the location was excellent, with many nice restaurants on the square, and easy walking to all of the city center sites. We were asked to pay in cash when we checked in, but simply told them that we did not have that much cash with us, and there was absolutely no problem using the credit card. I have to admit that I was very apprehensive about this reservation because of their reasonable prices for this kind of location, but I would not hesitate to stay there again. All 6 of us were extremely happy!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: There are much better places to stay I would not stay here again. We were transferred to this hotel after we arrived to find the hotel we had booked (Hotel Bigallo) was closed. Upon arrival we were offered no explanation for the move other than that the hotels are managed by the same company. Although the room was of a good size it was below standard. The bathroom was damp with wet patches on the wall and the ceiling. As a result of this the room smelt musty. On top if this we awoke in the morning to find NO running water. When we questioned this the only information they could give us was that it was a problem in the whole city. The staff were unhelpful and offered no apology. Unsurprisingly we were not the only unhappy guests.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: La Repubblica residence We stayed in a pleasant room with a perfect view over the Piazza Repubblica (not all have) right in the heart of the city. We felt very grand opening the huge wooden entrance door to the residence from the piazza. Since we're from East Anglia and unafraid of the 'cool' October air, we could open the shutters in the evening and enjoy the mix of music and activity from below. The room was comfortable, modern and clean with a kitchen-in-a-cupboard for coffee and snacks. Registration and breakfast are at the friendly De'Lanzi a few minutes walk away and an easy walk to the station and airport busses. Payment expected in cash. We're looking forward to a second stay.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great Value for the Price We had a great time at the De Lanzi. The hotel is in a superb location; next to the Duomo and within a short walk of every other interesting place in the city. The room was small but clean and quiet. The bathroom was spacious and very clean. Also, the staff was extremely kind and helpful, they worked very hard to get us tickets to the Uffizi with just a few hours notice (you need to make reservations days or weeks ahead).
Reviews.Author: Travelton

Reviews.Content: Great location, helpful staff Hotel is in an excellent location, walking distance to the major sites in Florence, and they offer tours to other areas that are especilly good if you do not have a car. Hotel itself was good, decent size room and bathroom. Breakfast was ok. Would stay here again if we return to Florence.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Delightful De Lanzi We had a long and wonderful weekend at the De Lanzi 8th -!0th October 2005. Absolutely lovely. Our room was very comfortable, light and airy, just as shown in the brochure. Clean, modern shower room (no bath). Breakfast was good and unlimited, (cold meats, fruit, cereal, croissants, fruit juice, yohurt, bread, coffee) extremely pleasant breakfast room. The hotel was better than we expected, the staff helpful, couteous and friendly. The hotel is situated right in the centre, (we could see the Duomo from our room!) just a couple of minutes walk from restuarants, squares and the Ponte Vechio. All in all we were not disappointed and would recommend the De Lanzi. RW 12th October 2005
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: There must be better places to stay.... The location was the only good thing the hotel had going for it. Everything else was sub-par. We thought we were in the wrong place when we arrived to a small elevator in a dark and bare building- the reception area is one floor above. The room was less than immaculate and seemed like the furtniture, bedding, etc. was about 20 years old. The breakfast was as basic as it could get, and the staff was less than warm. When checking out, they sprung on us that we had to pay cash. Also, they make you leave your key with them when you leave for the day- I didn't trust them or that system. It had the feeling of an old hospital, or some kind of run-down building. Next time we're in Florence, we prefer a nicer place, even if it costs more money.
Reviews.Author: StuckinNY

Reviews.Content: Find another place.....old, overpriced and they charge by the bed We booked on the Internet and they have used a wide angle lense. The rooms are so small. We asked for a 4 bed room. The choices on the internet were 2 beds or 4 beds. When we checked in , they asked us if we wanted 4 beds. The beds were about 12 inches apart. We could not even walk around the room. If my daughter or husband wanted to use the bathroom, the others would have to sit on the bed as you could not pass by. When we checked out , we found that they charge by the BED, not by the number of people in the room. I tried reasoning with them as there were just 3 of us, but they said they asked us if we wanted 4 beds and we said yes. The room have not been redone in years and are old and dull. Since the room was so small, we could not even relax in the room as our heads were all so close. Yes, you can see the Duomo from the room, but nothing is faraway in Florence, My advice: get a better room and walk a few extra blocks. We will never stay there again. We were sorry that we booked and paid for it in advance.
Reviews.Author: MARGEKG

Reviews.Content: Good hotel, good price, great location The De Lanzi is in the perfect location. Naples can be a difficult town to navigate, but being in front of the port and in the center of all the major attractions, the De Lanzi makes Naples easy to visit. It is off a side street in the center of town. Noise was not a problem and the staff was friendly and helpful. The bathroom had a broken shower door and leaky toilet - but it seemed to fit the character of a crazy Naples. Breakfast was minimal, but there is a coffee bar right across the street.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Perfect location in the middle of Florence       De Lanzi is the yellow building right in the middle of this pic taken from the tower!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great location, good experience My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights as part of a Rome/Florence vacation in April (3 days after the Pope died - we were in Rome during the weekend of his death, a 5 minute walk from St. Peter's....). We thought the room was very nice, though the opened window let in an unpleasant odor. The desk staff were very helpful and friendly and we really loved the location. It is about 50 meters off of the Doumo/Bell Tower square and this made for a nice view almost immediately upon exiting the main entrance. The central location made it a fairly short trip from the train station and a reasonable walk to virtually anyplace in the city. When we booked on the internet we got a great rate of 85 euro per night. But upon checking out I was told the internet rate is cash only, otherwise it's double that price as I whipped out my American Express card. Needless to say we made a quick run to the ATM during our last morning stroll around town to withdraw the cash needed. I didn't remember any fine print about a cash only rate and double checked when I got home and still didn't see it. So, I guess be ready for that if you get a really low internet price, say under 100 euro. Other than that mild surprise everything went great. The breakfast is decent, also.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Should Have Been Better For the amount of money spent on this hotel we should have had a luxury room. The location was great, close to everything, but there were alot of problems. The room smelled like there was a dead rodent somewhere, and the staff just said there was nothing to worry about. The small alley outside was where (I assume) college students or homeless people went to the bathroom. I just feel that for the amount we spent the quality of the room and overall hotel should have been alot better. I was looking forward to our stay here but I don't know if I would go back again. The staff was not especially helpful in most situations. Not recommended for people who want to stray from the crowds. There were tourist hordes everywhere in this area.
Reviews.Author: shawnbo

Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel in the center of Florence       Room
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: best location, average hotel We stayed at the De' Lanzi for Easter 2005. We are a late 20s couple that often look for well priced but comfortable hotels in good locations. We found the hotel perfectly suited to spend a few days in Florence. It is in walking distance to all the attractions and sits a brief moment from the Duomo. Hotel room good points: Average but comfortable. Nice and friendly staff. Clean. Handy small safe in room. Bathroom worked fine, though small shower cubicle (but typical of 3 star).Hotel room bad points: Room was quite cold, thermostat not very receptive. No view at all from our room. Was a bit noisy from the street noise below. Doors are thin so hallway noise is quite loud. Very small TV. All in all a pleasant stay in a standard 3-star. Would definitely stay there again particularly because of the location.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Perfect location! The hotel was right in the middle of town, within walking distance of the Duomo. Hotel was small and quaint. It gave a good local flavor of the town. Breakfast buffet was good as the previous hotel that we stayed in cost more and did not have a breakfast included. Food and taxis were VERYexpensive in Italy. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful as I had to search out a doctor for a minor eye infection. Ask about the room descriptions when you check in. We had two rooms. One did not have much of a view and was behind a hall door, almost like a closet door. The other had a shower in the middle of the bathroom with no enclosure. We had a pleasant stay however next time I think we would stay in a hotel a little more upscale.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great views, great location Stayed in March with 3 friends (had 2 rooms). One room had an excellent view of the Duomo, the other had a small view of the Palazzo Vecchio. Only stayed for one night and missed breakfast, so can't comment on that. The location is absolutely perfect! Besides the views (I'm sure all rooms don't have views) the hotel is right in the center of town...very close to all tourist sites. Staff was very helpful... recommending restaurants, making reservations, storing luggage. Very quiet room with clean bathrooms and actual shower door (have stayed in Florence before with no shower door). We had a nice sized room (was a triple, but only had 2 people). Would hightly recommend this hotel.
Reviews.Author: fsufan

Reviews.Content: Lovely Location Like most of the other reviews this hotel's best feature is its location--can see the duomo from your room. It is located on a side street, but it can sometimes get a bit noisy with people traffic. Remember, Italians like to stay out late, when we Americans like to sleep!Staff was very courteous, and the breakfast buffet was good, but fairly typical of Italy--rolls, coffee, juice, cheese, ham.Our beds slept well, the room was always clean, the bathroom was fine (even if shower was a bit small), and our time in Florence made that more enjoyable by our stay here.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great Location. Average Hotel Stayed at the De Lanzi in November 2004. On the plus side, the hotel is in an excellent location right on Piazza Duomo. Interior of hotel is very clean, but very spartan. Nothing quaint or romantic about it. Breakfast was good, but not great. I had telephoned before arrival requesting a quiet room, and our room (which faced the Duomo) was very quiet and the beds were comfortable. On the minus side, the entrance to the hotel is really dismal -- looks like a flophouse from the outside. The guestroom was very small. For the most part, the shower water was lukewarm, not hot. The front desk staff were courteous, but not friendly. They refused to take messages from callers which was a big problem since this was a business trip. The hotel is located in a zone that allows taxis, but does not allow privately-owned cars. This is a plus if you're worried about street traffic, but a minus if you have a car or friends with a car. We paid nearly $200 per night for the DeLanzi. In May 2004, we stayed at the magnificent Bernini Palace (a Baglioni chain hotel) for about the same price. Would have preferred the Bernini in November, but it was fully booked. Note: there's also a Baglioni Grand hotel near the train station which is not affiliated with the Baglioni chain. Don't know anything about the Baglioni Palace. Florence is magnificent. I've been twice in 6 months and am happy to share my experiences if you email me: GourmetGirl2@hotmail.com.
Reviews.Author: JCM1949

Reviews.Content: Horrible-Stay Away We stayed at the Hotel De Lanzi in September, 2004 and will NEVER stay there again. We stayed there based on other trip advisor reviews but got there and was completed disappointed. Although the location is good, the noise is awful and the service was terrible. We counted at least six other couples that complained of various problems during the two days we were there. Howevee the biggest problem was that we got LOCKED in our room for over an hour. We had to get the desk person to open our door the first night because our key wouldn't open the door and he tried to blame us until he had trouble opening it too and then in the morning it wouldn't open at all from the inside or the outside. The people were useless and again tried to blame us for closing the door too hard etc...ridiculous! We saw from the marks on the door that someone else had been locked in that room too and tried to force the lock to get out. There were no fire escapes and no ladders to get out. They finally let down a bag of random tools through a window on an extension cord (!) and my husband got us out...then to add insult to injury said because we got a discounted rate to begin with they wouldn't give us our money back but just changed our room...I guess because we didn't pay full rate it was OK that we were locked in for over an hour without a way to get out. I have never been so upset by the service in a hotel. Please take my advise do NOT stay here.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: De' Lanzi something special. All the Reception staff were so friendly and caring, were able to speak good english, extremely helpful and enthusiastic, answering our questions regarding recommending good local restaurants and booking them for us, all of which turned out to be excellent, help and advice on tourist attractions in Florence and environs, booking excursions, advice on directions on how to get there both by car and public transport, taking the strain out of holiday itinerary thus making it so much more relaxed and enjoyable.The Hotel has all modern conveniences, which work, our room was well appointed had a very comfortable double bed and was a very quiet room so we could get a goods nights sleep. We felt this was common to all rooms based on its location, so close to the Piazza Del Duomo only a 50 metre walk away but in a quiet side street.Breakfast was served in a friendly restaurant with a good buffet choice to keep you going all day if desired!We are extremely grateful to all at the Hotel for all their kindness, help and expertise that made our holiday a really enjoyable, relaxing and fulfilling experiance.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Loved the Hotel The hotel was very clean and in a great part of town. It's about a 10 minute walk from the train station. The bathroom was large compared to the other hotels we stayed at in Italy. We were very pleased with everything about the room and the service. The only problem we found was the day trips they offered were very expensive. You can go to another hotel or travel office in Florence and find the same trip for more than 1/2 the price! Also, breakfast is not included, but there are some good bakery's in the general area.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Hotel De Lanzi The hotel was in an ideal location. Great views of the Dumo. Within walking distance of all major attractions and train station. Clean rooms. Some problems with the phone and TV not working properly, but otherwise ok. Staff was extremely helpful.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great Staff at the De' Lanzi We had a terrific 7 night stay at the De 'Lanzi hotel situated in the center of the city with easy access to all the sites. The staff was helpful with directions, tours, and restaurants. The rooms were nice as well as we could count on the water in the shower to stay hot. We were not that lucky in Rome. We loved hearing the morning bells from the Bell tower and glad we were not on a main street to hear the early morning and late evening street noise.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great Stay! Prime location and friendly staff make this hotel enjoyable.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Best location! This hotel was clean, pleasant, and in a fantastic location -- 1/2 block to the Duomo and fabulous shopping. The staff were friendly and courteous and all were fluent in English. We only made it to breakfast on one out of three mornings (a testament to how comfortable the room was!) but it was typical of an Italian breakfast -- coffee, rolls, cereals, fruit, yogut, etc. I don't think you can do better for the money.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great view/location, nice staff       View of Duomo from hotel window (I'm not sure all rooms have view)
Reviews.Author: H_Leeper

Reviews.Content: Great location Friendly, responsive staff. Great location, near the Duomo, many other attractions and shopping. Clean rooms and a good European breakfast. We would definitely stay here again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Hotel de Lanzi - Perfect location and a great shower! When I arrived in Florence, it was raining and dark, and the taxi line was 100 people long. I was able to walk to Hotel de Lanzi in no time at all, with no trouble at all, as it is located right next to the Duomo. Hotel de Lanzi is in the perfect location - it's close to all the major sites in Florence! The staff is friendly and speaks English well. The rooms are typical Italian hotel rooms - a bit small - but with modern touches (tv, safe); the shower was great, and the towels fluffy and big. I would definitely stay here again if I'm lucky enough to return to Florence.
Reviews.Author: dsquarednz
